channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Explosion at a Pennsylvania nursing home kills at least 2, governor says
item.description: The explosion collapsed a part of the building and happened just as a utility crew had been on site looking for a gas leak at Bristol Health & Rehab Center in Bristol Township, just outside Philadelphia.
item.content:encoded:
The explosion collapsed a part of the building and happened just as a utility crew had been on site looking for a gas leak at Bristol Health & Rehab Center in Bristol Township, just outside Philadelphia.

(Image credit: Monica Herndon/The Philadelphia Inquirer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The Trump administration is recalling about 30 career diplomats
item.description: The Trump administration is recalling dozens of career Ambassadors, saying the president wants diplomats who will advance his agenda. That's what foreign service officers sign up for.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is recalling dozens of career Ambassadors, saying the president wants diplomats who will advance his agenda. That's what foreign service officers sign up for.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: A rising country music singer speaks out about his family member arrested by ICE
item.description: When a family member of a popular country music singer was arrested by ICE, he spoke out publicly about the emotional toll of family separation because of immigration bureaucracy.
item.content:encoded: When a family member of a popular country music singer was arrested by ICE, he spoke out publicly about the emotional toll of family separation because of immigration bureaucracy.
item.dc:creator: Rose Gilbert

item.title: Supreme Court rules against Trump in National Guard case
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into the state of Illinois over the objections of the governor.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into the state of Illinois over the objections of the governor.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Habitat for Humanity is known for building homes. Costs have some chapters pivoting
item.description: Some Habitat for Humanity chapters are altering their model and using factory-built housing on some of their sites. It's a change for the organization and for its volunteers.
item.content:encoded: Some Habitat for Humanity chapters are altering their model and using factory-built housing on some of their sites. It's a change for the organization and for its volunteers.
item.dc:creator: Addie Costello

item.title: Student loan borrowers in default may soon see their wages garnished
item.description: About 5.5 million borrowers are currently in default. They haven't risked wage garnishment since the beginning of the pandemic, when policymakers paused the practice.
item.content:encoded: About 5.5 million borrowers are currently in default. They haven't risked wage garnishment since the beginning of the pandemic, when policymakers paused the practice.
item.dc:creator: Sequoia Carrillo

item.title: 2025: The images that stayed with us
item.description: Photographs help us look back on the moments that defined the year. Taken by NPR photojournalists nationwide, this collection goes beyond the headlines to reveal quietly powerful human stories.
item.content:encoded:
Photographs help us look back on the moments that defined the year. Taken by NPR photojournalists nationwide, this collection goes beyond the headlines to reveal quietly powerful human stories.

(Image credit: Tyler Russell)
item.dc:creator: Meredith Nierman

item.title: Trump's plans for warship fleet. And, deported Venezuelans must receive due process
item.description: President Trump has announced the Navy will begin building a new fleet of warships. And, a federal judge has ruled the deportations of more than 100 Venezuelan men to El Salvador were illegal.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has announced the Navy will begin building a new fleet of warships. And, a federal judge has ruled the deportations of more than 100 Venezuelan men to El Salvador were illegal.

(Image credit: Andrew Canallero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: U.S. says it struck another alleged drug-smuggling boat in eastern Pacific, killing 1
item.description: The U.S. military announced Monday that it conducted a strike against another alleged drug-smuggling boat in the Eastern Pacific Ocean, killing one person.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. military announced Monday that it conducted a strike against another alleged drug-smuggling boat in the Eastern Pacific Ocean, killing one person.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Heavy rain, flooding could soak parts of California during the holidays
item.description: A series of atmospheric rivers are threatening California with heavy rain and potential flooding during the holiday week.
item.content:encoded: A series of atmospheric rivers are threatening California with heavy rain and potential flooding during the holiday week.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Stark
